comments:
I am getting following error when I set the default value for datetime input, which is the input to the stored procedure.

Could you please give me your call statement?Thanks.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Could you please give me your call statement?Thanks.

Find the procedure call

{call dbo.procedure_name;1(?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)} 

Default parameters 
param1 (datetime): '01/01/2006'
param2 (datetime): '03/28/2006'
param3 (int)     : 1
param4 (string)  : 'current'
param5 (string)  : 'user'
param6 (int)     : 1

Thanks for your feedback. We still need more details about your environement.

1: birt version
2: database and its version
3: jdbc driver and its version.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Thanks for your feedback. We still need more details about your environement.
> 1: birt version
> 2: database and its version
> 3: jdbc driver and its version.

1) birt version/eclipse
   2.0.1/3.1.2
2: database and its version
   sybase 12.5.1.411
3: jdbc driver and its version.
   jConnect for JDBC 2.0" 
   Specification-Version: "5.5"
Seems specific to sybase, need more time on it.

In my environement I cannot reproduce this bug... From your information, are you sure that the order of parameter value you input is consistent with the stored procedure( especially the datatype is corresponding )?  Or maybe you could try the latest version to verify it. Waiting for you response...

I can give you my environement FYI:
1) birt version/eclipse
   2.1RC2/3.2M6
2: database and its version
   sybase 12.5.2
3: jdbc driver and its version.
   jConnect for JDBC 2.0" 
   Specification-Version: "5.5"
but I cannot reproduce this bug, so I will close this bug. If this bug still exist in your environement, please reopen it.
